meganorm.plots package

Submodules

meganorm.plots.fooofFitnessVis module

meganorm.plots.fooofFitnessVis.averaged_psds_component(paths)[source]

Reads fooof results (in pickle) and averages PSDs, aperiodic, and periodic components. Returns the averaged components along with frequencies.

meganorm.plots.fooofFitnessVis.compute_fittness_metric(paths)[source]

Returns errors, R2s and number of peaks in fooof models

meganorm.plots.fooofFitnessVis.plot_ap_fixed_r2(fixed_r2s, knee_r2s, save_path)[source]

Returns stacked histogram of R2 scors for aperiodic and periodic components

meganorm.plots.fooofFitnessVis.plot_knee_fixed_compare_psd(freqs, psds, fixed_aperiodics, knee_aperiodics, save_path)[source]

Plot the aperiodic, periodic and original PSDs (not in log log space)

meganorm.plots.fooofFitnessVis.plot_log_log_fooof(freqs, psds, fixed_ap, knee_ap, save_path)[source]

meganorm.plots.plots.plot_comparison(path, hbr_configs, biomarker_num, metrics=['Rho', 'SMSE', 'MSLL', 'MACE'], plot_type='boxplot')[source]
meganorm.plots.plots.plot_feature_scatter(df, feature_names, save_fig_path)[source]

pltots the scatter plot of the specified features

meganorm.plots.plots.plot_growthchart(age_vector, centiles_matrix, cut=0, idp='', save_path=None)[source]

Plots growth chart for two sexes.

Parameters:

  • age_vector (numpy.ndarray) – A 1D array representing the age values.

  • centiles_matrix (numpy.ndarray) – A 3D array of shape (age_vector.shape[0], 5, 2) where the second dimension represents the 5 centiles and the third dimension represents the 2 sexes (0 for male, 1 for female).

  • cut (int, optional) – The cutting age for the younger population. Defaults to 0.

  • idp (str, optional) – IDP name. Defaults to ‘’.

  • save_path (str, optional) – If not None saves the plot to the path. Defaults to None.

meganorm.plots.plots.plot_growthcharts(path, idp_indices, idp_names, site=1, point_num=100)[source]

Plotting growth charts for multiple idps.

Parameters:

  • path (string) – Path to processing directory in which the quantiles are saved.

  • idp_indices (list) – A list of IDP indices.

  • idp_names (list) – A list of IDP names corresponding to IDP indices.

  • site (int, optional) – The site id to plot. Defaults to 0.

  • point_num (int, optional) – Number of points used in creating the synthetic X. Defaults to 100.

meganorm.plots.plots.plot_metrics(metrics_path, which_features, feature_new_name=[], save_path=None)[source]
meganorm.plots.plots.plot_neurooscillochart(data, age_slices, save_path)[source]
meganorm.plots.plots.plot_nm_range(processing_dir, data_dir, quantiles=[0.05, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 0.95], age_range=[15, 90], ind=0, parallel=True, save_plot=True, outputsuffix='estimate')[source]

Function to plot notmative ranges. This function assumes only gender as batch effect stored in the first column of batch effect array.

Parameters:

  • processing_dir (str) – Path to normative modeling processing directory.

  • quantiles (list, optional) – Plotted centiles. Defaults to [0.05, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 0.95].

  • ind (int, optional) – Index of target biomarker to plot. Defaults to 0.

  • parallel (bool, optional) – Is parallel NM used to estimate the model?. Defaults to True.

  • save_plot (bool, optional) – Save the plot?. Defaults to True.

  • outputsuffix (str, optional) – outputsuffix in normative modeling. Defaults to ‘estimate’.

meganorm.plots.plots.plot_nm_range_site(processing_dir, data_dir, quantiles=[0.05, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 0.95], save_plot=True, outputsuffix='estimate', experiment_id=0, batch_curve={0: ['Male', 'Female']}, batch_marker={1: ['CAMCAN', 'BTNRH']})[source]

Function to plot notmative ranges. This function assumes only gender as batch effect stored in the first column of batch effect array.

Parameters:

  • processing_dir (str) – Path to normative modeling processing directory.

  • quantiles (list, optional) – Plotted centiles. Defaults to [0.05, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 0.95].

  • ind (int, optional) – Index of target biomarker to plot. Defaults to 0.

  • parallel (bool, optional) – Is parallel NM used to estimate the model?. Defaults to True.

  • save_plot (bool, optional) – Save the plot?. Defaults to True.

  • outputsuffix (str, optional) – outputsuffix in normative modeling. Defaults to ‘estimate’.

meganorm.plots.plots.plot_nm_range_site2(processing_dir, data_dir, quantiles=[0.05, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 0.95], save_plot=True, outputsuffix='estimate', experiment_id=0, batch_curve={'sex': ['Male', 'Female']}, batch_marker={'site': ['BTH', 'Cam-Can', 'NIMH', 'OMEGA', 'HCP', 'MOUS']}, new_names=['Theta', 'Alpha', 'Beta', 'Gamma'], colors=['#006685', '#591154', '#E84653', 'black', '#E6B213', 'Slategrey'])[source]

Function to plot notmative ranges. This function assumes only gender as batch effect stored in the first column of batch effect array.

Parameters:

  • processing_dir (str) – Path to normative modeling processing directory.

  • quantiles (list, optional) – Plotted centiles. Defaults to [0.05, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 0.95].

  • ind (int, optional) – Index of target biomarker to plot. Defaults to 0.

  • parallel (bool, optional) – Is parallel NM used to estimate the model?. Defaults to True.

  • save_plot (bool, optional) – Save the plot?. Defaults to True.

  • outputsuffix (str, optional) – outputsuffix in normative modeling. Defaults to ‘estimate’.

meganorm.plots.plots.plot_quantile_gauge(current_value, q1, q3, percentile_5, percentile_95, percentile_50, title='Quantile-Based Gauge', min_value=0, max_value=1, show_legend=False, bio_name=None, save_path='')[source]

Plots a gauge chart based on quantile ranges with a threshold marker for the 0.5 percentile.

Parameters: - current_value (float): The current decimal value to display. - q1 (float): The 25th percentile value as a decimal. - q3 (float): The 75th percentile value as a decimal. - percentile_5 (float): The 5th percentile value as a decimal. - percentile_95 (float): The 95th percentile value as a decimal. - percentile_50 (float): The 0.5 percentile value as a decimal, marked by a threshold line. - title (str): The title of the gauge chart. - min_value (float): The minimum value for the gauge range (default is 0). - max_value (float): The maximum value for the gauge range (default is 1). - show_legend (bool): Whether to display the legend with color-coded ranges (default is False).

meganorm.plots.plots.qq_plot(processing_dir, save_fig, label_dict)[source]
